This workgropu introduces:

-   Interactions in multiple linear regression
-   Interpretation of interaction coefficients
-   Sum coding (a.k.a. deviation/effect coding)
-   Marginal means and simple slopes (`emmeans`)

In this session we will examine how to execute and interpret multiple linear regression models with interactions.

We will look at examples of models with a combination of interactions between categorical and continuous predictor and the interpretation of its coefficients in each of the cases with two different types of dummy variable coding: treatment (dummy) coding and sum (deviation/effect) coding.

# ðŸ§  Learning Objectives {.unnumbered}

By the end of this lesson, you will be able to:

-   Fit and interpret a multiple linear model with interactions using `lm()` .

-   Review concept of marginal means in the presence of interactions.

-   Visualize interactions in models.

-   Understand concept of sum coding.

-   Report interactions in multiple linear models.
